page.title: 01Stiperstones Field Centre
page.content: The Centre was built in 1839 as a{church}but for most of its time it has been a{school.}The school closed in 1968 when it became a field centre for the use of Shropshire schools. There is{no electricity}and bottled gas is used for heating,lighting and cooking. There are arched windows which allow most of the light in. There are photos of local ponds and nature books. There are cabinets with old boots and local rocks including quartz and galena. There are six windows and the clock has stopped at a quarter to six. Outside there are four small chalets which can sleep 4/5 children and have blue plastic flaps for doors. There are three toilts outside for the girls and one for the boys. There is also a grass area for tents. There is a kitchen, large workroom and a washroom.
